title: Cointxz
author: Cointxz
content: Since most of the crypto casino nowadays offers free withdrawal fee on most of the cryptocurrency sometimes immediate withdrawal after the game is very convenient now but for players like me that usually play on irregular basis, I really want to leave my balance on the casino so that I can play immediately whenever I like.I only leave money on casino balance if it’s less than 1000$ or less but this is only applicable on casino that I used for more than a year.What about you guys? Do you leave your balance in your casino balance or you withdraw immediately regardless of the reputation of the casino?

comments.author: Kakmakr
comments.body: Well, I will not use my favorite casino as a wallet, if that is what you are asking...  It will be very risky for people to use casinos as wallets, because some casino operators and support staff are very trigger happy ..and they will block accounts for little or no reason at all. When this happens, you as a owner of those coins, will not have access to those coins. The other things is.... if you store all your coins on the casino, then you will be tempted to gamble with it. My advice... keep most of your coins on hardware wallets and determine a gambling budget for every casino that you use... and only deposit those coins onto those casinos.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: I spend most of what I deposit (since I deposit on a regular basis most of the time) since I'm fully committed to spending all of it for my enjoyment, but whenever I say win big, I tend to leave and basically just sum it up to equate to my regular deposits monthly. It's pretty random I think but pretty small most of the time (less than a $100). So I guess I've never really withdrawn directly, but indirectly it did reduce the amount I deposit to play with, hence "indirectly". If I do stop to play I just leave the money there (not that it's much in the first place) and do not really withdraw it till the day I want to play again.

comments.author: ethereumhunter
comments.body: Usually, I leave some small money in the casino just in case I want to return in the next few days so I do not have to deposit more. With that money, I can directly play any gambling games without a problem. But if I can win much money, I will immediately withdraw my win and still leave some money, maybe less than $25, in my account. But it is rarely I can win much money playing gambling because I do not see good luck in me while gambling. Besides, I only play occasionally and do not use too big money.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: Coin_trader on September 22, 2022, 04:52:54 AM Do you leave your balance in your casino balance or you withdraw immediately regardless of the reputation of the casino?Reputation matters a lot and that will be the first thing I'll consider before leaving any amount of money in my casino balance. For a casino with a good reputation and long-standing I would only keep a fixed amount that I have resolved to use for gambling for say that period in my casino balance just to ensure that I can keep my gambling activities in check.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: We have the same thought of leaving some funds in a casino where we're playing so that we don't have that hassle of depositing again after withdrawing. We'll have to pay for the fee again to the network although it's not that a lot but sometimes, it's really making us think that it's a lot of effort to do so. Not just much for me to leave, maybe around $50-$200 would be the ideal for me. Unless I want to add more but I don't want to leave that much there.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Leaving your balance in a casino depends on how good or convenient you are with the site, most at time i just actually make deposit with the casino that supports my local currency this was because i could get contacted by a friend of mine who always share games with me to gamble in two to three gambling site, sometimes i find it difficult for my deposit to reflect on time before placing my bet at this points the odds changes and reduce from the previous odds. So what i does after having such experience was to leave some funds in those casino site, which is from $10 to $30 ~ NGN 21k at 713 per $1.

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: I usually leave my balance in the casino since I only play on trusted Casino but I start withdrawing now my balance every session that I finish since I experience submitting KYC while my balance is still in my casino account. I have no choice but to  submit requirements or else my balance will be loss. This is some danger that a casino player can experience when you are leaving your balance in the casino even if the casino is trusted or not because you don’t know if you violate some of the casino terms unknowingly.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Coin_trader on September 22, 2022, 04:52:54 AMSince most of the crypto casino nowadays offers free withdrawal fee on most of the cryptocurrency sometimes immediate withdrawal after the game is very convenient now but for players like me that usually play on irregular basis, I really want to leave my balance on the casino so that I can play immediately whenever I like.Most gambling sites are not offering free withdrawal if it is crypto withdrawal. I have only seen free withdrawal while using fiat. But crypto withdrawal like litecoin and many other altcoins are of low amount which can almost be considered as nothing.Quote from: Coin_trader on September 22, 2022, 04:52:54 AMWhat about you guys? Do you leave your balance in your casino balance or you withdraw immediately regardless of the reputation of the casino?My deposit are left on the casino and other gambling sites that I am using, I only withdrawal only the amount I make when I win from gambling. I too just like to have some amount left, so that I would be able to gamble anytime I just want to again.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I'm now having a gambling hiatus of some sort. I'm now seldom betting. But that's only as far as crypto gambling is concerned. So I'm currently not leaving any amount on betting platforms for now. My one account even got deactivated for being inactive and the funds taken. I'm not sure why such a policy. Back when I was active, I used to keep several hundreds or even a thousand on gambling accounts. I particularly intended it that way because I loved live betting and I got annoyed a number of times for failing to make the most of fleeting odds because I got easily drained of funds. Anyway, even if you're not leaving significant amounts, your platform should be reliable.

comments.author: TopTort777
comments.created_time: September 22, 2022, 10:02:45 AMLast edit: September 22, 2022, 12:35:56 PM by TopTort777
comments.body: All of my lunch money  Just kidding, I dont save lunch money to gamble, I prefer to eat than to feel hungry but play. I think I havent lost much. I am sure that I have lost 1 BNB, because accidentally havent switched it to other crypto and accidentally played all-in in dice autobet. Besides that, maybe only couple of hundred bucks worth crypto. I mainly either use faucet money, or gamble low bet, because I seek joy of playing, than aim to win big. I prefer to keep just an amount I can allow to lose - that will be less than 50 bucks.

comments.body: Quote from: Coin_trader on September 22, 2022, 04:52:54 AMSince most of the crypto casino nowadays offers free withdrawal fee on most of the cryptocurrency sometimes immediate withdrawal after the game is very convenient now but for players like me that usually play on irregular basis, I really want to leave my balance on the casino so that I can play immediately whenever I like.I only leave money on casino balance if it’s less than 1000$ or less but this is only applicable on casino that I used for more than a year.What about you guys? Do you leave your balance in your casino balance or you withdraw immediately regardless of the reputation of the casino?Only small chunk since I can't afford to sleep in a night leaving a huge amount of money on a platform which is out of my control. So I usually deposit low amount only especially if I don't have plans to play for quite long time on a casino.  Regardless on reputation still I very much careful on the amount I spend because I don't want to encounter an issue since even if the casino is reputable or a good one still they are prone to issues.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: Coin_trader on September 22, 2022, 04:52:54 AMSince most of the crypto casino nowadays offers free withdrawal fee on most of the cryptocurrency sometimes immediate withdrawal after the game is very convenient now but for players like me that usually play on irregular basis, I really want to leave my balance on the casino so that I can play immediately whenever I like.I only leave money on casino balance if it’s less than 1000$ or less but this is only applicable on casino that I used for more than a year.What about you guys? Do you leave your balance in your casino balance or you withdraw immediately regardless of the reputation of the casino?I don't leave any balance on the casino as 99% of the times I lose all of the money that I have allocated for playing.In the rare 1% case where I win also withdraw immediately my money as I have the opinion that money stays better in a wallet where I have the private keys rather in some third party wallet where I don't own the private keys despite the casino being one of the most reputable ones or the most reputable one.I have been burned by CEX.io centralized exchange where they have frozen my funds by their will despite me proving them all evidence that my funds come from mining so I don't leave money or balance in any other place that is a wallet in my full control,I learned the hard way but better late than ever.

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: I left some money in my gambling account but not too much because I am also not a regular gambler like the others. I only leave my balance at a casino I trust, so I don't have to worry about anything because that casino will take care of it for me. But maybe you can leave less than $100 or $50 in your account so that you can start playing right away if you want to play. Even though the casino has a good reputation, leaving a large amount of money in our account is not recommended.

comments.author: masulum
comments.body: I prefer to withdraw the money from casino when I win. it's not just about reputation. but about of my bad gambling activity, when I keeping my money in casino, I will continue to play and lose control after few time playing the game. Then I only left my stupidity for continuing to play until all of money gone. So, everytime i won more than 5x from my deposit, i will manage to withdraw.

comments.author: iv4n
comments.body: Quote from: masulum on September 22, 2022, 11:44:51 AMI prefer to withdraw the money from casino when I win. it's not just about reputation. but about of my bad gambling activity, when I keeping my money in casino, I will continue to play and lose control after few time playing the game. Then I only left my stupidity for continuing to play until all of money gone. So, everytime i won more than 5x from my deposit, i will manage to withdraw.Lately, after some bigger win, I withdraw the entire balance to my wallet and I make a new deposit in some other casino! Somehow after winning big if I stay in the same casino most likely I will lose everything, so I like a fresh start, and if I lose it I will still have some of my winnings from before! For me, it's not a problem to leave $100-200 in casinos for gambling, everything over that would be too much! I never had any problems with any of the reputable casinos around regarding my bankroll or something similar.

comments.author: BobK71
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on September 22, 2022, 06:03:29 AMWell, I will not use my favorite casino as a wallet, if that is what you are asking...  It will be very risky for people to use casinos as wallets, because some casino operators and support staff are very trigger happy ..and they will block accounts for little or no reason at all. When this happens, you as a owner of those coins, will not have access to those coins. The other things is.... if you store all your coins on the casino, then you will be tempted to gamble with it. My advice... keep most of your coins on hardware wallets and determine a gambling budget for every casino that you use... and only deposit those coins onto those casinos.  It is true that keeping your money in the casino means you are keeping your wealth to others or at risk. Casino account may close at any time. However, it is a little different for those who have been using the casino for a long time. I think you can keep your money as much as you need to play casino game for every day. Anything above that amount should be transfer to your personal wallet.

comments.author: CoinEraser
comments.body: I'd rather pay fees and cash out my winnings. Unless I play again that day or the next day. I see it that way: Not your keys, not your coins. I try to keep the risk of losing my coins as small as possible. Even if I trust the casino, something can always happen. I've experienced this a few times and I don't want to experience it again. I sometimes pay unnecessary fees, but it always makes me feel safe.

comments.author: Peanutswar
comments.body: It is not quite ideal to leave the funds in the gambling casino but if you don't need really too much the funds or just a spare you can leave it so it is more convenient if you want to play back but in some cases possible there's a chance that the gambling casino makes some update, rug the funds of the players and etc. those are the possible scenario might happen but if you will play in the casino which is reputable already and you trust already there's nothing to worry about.

Do you leave your balance in your casino balance or you withdraw immediately regardless of the reputation of the casino?I'm not the kind of leaving a huge balance in a casino or exchange if I will leave, it is so I can use it for another session it will not be more than $100, I'm only a small player so I am not comfortable with a big amount on my dashboard but  I have one casino where I leave my token to earn from staking I have no choice I have to trust the casino for me to leave my token to earn from staking if you're going to store a huge amount on one casino it should be on a casino that the community trusted, I'm talking about Betfury I'm sure the community trust this casino.
